content.p: The China Ports: History, Heritage and Development network brings together historians, archaeologists, Sinologists, art historians, engineers, social scientists and museum curators with shared interests in maritime China. 「中國港口聯繫網絡」使歷史學家、考古學家、漢學家、藝術史家、工程師、社會科學家和博物館館長共聚一個平台，分享海洋中國的興趣與探索。 The network is funded by the Arts and Humanities Research Council. The main banner image on the homepage of the China Ports network is copyright SOAS, University of London and HIstoical Photographs, University of Bristol. The other black and white images used on China Ports network webpages are copyright G. Warren Swire. Images courtesy of John Swire and Sons Ltd., and Historical Photographs of China, University of Bristol. The "Aims" dockyard image is extracted from the On The Docks propaganda poster courtesy of the International Institute of Social History, Amsterdam. The "Resources" image is a Chinese coloured map of the town of Amoy (copyright the British Library). The University of Nottingham Department of History Nottingham, NG7 2RD telephone: +44 (0) 115 74 84476 email:Jeremy.Taylor@nottingham.ac.uk
